ai.summary: A challenging 19.5 km loop around the Mottisfont Estate in the UK, featuring a mix of woodland paths, estate tracks and open fields. Expect long distances, occasional ascents and variable surface conditions—best tackled by experienced hikers with good stamina.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied: grassy trails, gravel tracks, forest paths and field edges. Ground can be uneven with exposed roots; mud is common after rain. Short steep sections and several stiles or gate crossings may be encountered. Weather in the UK can change quickly, so be prepared.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day: start early, check the forecast, and carry adequate water. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and be prepared for mud, especially after rain. Stay on marked paths and respect private land; close gates behind you. Bring a map, compass or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Tell someone your route and expected return time. In winter or after rain, trail conditions can be hazardous; consider postponing.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing and a waterproof outer layer
Map, compass or offline GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of extended daylight loss)
Walking poles (optional but helpful on long descents)
Whistle and basic first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal; summer offers longer daylight hours, while autumn provides comfortable temperatures and scenery. In winter or after heavy rain, trail conditions can be very muddy and footing may be hazardous.

seo.title: Mottisfont Estate Walk – 19.5 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 19.5 km Mottisfont Estate Walk, a challenging route around Mottisfont Estate in the UK. Terrain insights, safety tips, gear recommendations and best seasons for this demanding hike.
